alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 6:22PM CST until January 13 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 11 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Cook and Lake County. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 11 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow has diminished and little to no additional accumulations are expected. North to northeast winds gusting up to 35 mph may cause blowing and drifting of the newly fallen snow. Road conditions may remain poor tonight, so plan on slippery roads if you will be out traveling tonight.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
